title: What is the most powerful PC available to consumers? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on how much the consumers are willing to spend on their computer. When I purchased my hexcore AlienWare Aurora desktop (gaming) computer with 2x2TB disk space, 32 GB RAM and a lot of other powerful features, I paid over €5,500 for it. (Roughly $6,000 back then.) That’s not a price the average consumer is willing to pay, though. If you have the cash, I think you can actually buy an IBM zEnterprise BC12 mainframe for around $75,000. Chances are that you can purchase them for even lower prices as second-hands hardware or at auctions. It’s not really a consumer computer anymore but then again, neither is my desktop which I need for software development and for making CGI artwork. I had a colleague who actually managed to buy three of those systems from a company that had recently upgraded their hardware and wanted to get rid of his old stuff. He paid a few hundred euros for them and had to find some additional hardware components to use with them but he got them all to work just fine. There are likely many more mainframes available for sale if you know where to look. Also, modern computers are still getting more powerful every day. Question is more like: how much power do you need?

Well the most expensive is the 8Pack OrionX. It is probably one of the most powerful available to consumers. It is technically two separate computers in the one case but it is a beast. Its insanely fast and more than anyone would need.
